intro: Orthocarpus mariposanus, commonly known as the Mariposa orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Orthocarpus mariposanus thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat.
